intro: Lapeirousia micrantha, commonly known as the dwarf rain lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically evergreen. Lapeirousia micrantha is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils.
